update.description:
[This](http://osrf-distributions.s3.amazonaws.com/gazebo/api/dev/classgazebo_1_1gui_1_1EntityMaker.html) is the current structure:

![makers.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3750000366-makers.png)

This is the one introduced in this pull request:

![makers2.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/601007612-makers2.png)

This pull request is mainly addressing issue #66, and also fixes issue #1583.

* Removed `MeshMaker` and `g_meshCreateAct` because they are not used and similar functionality has been moved to the Model Editor.

* Removed `BoxMaker`, `CylinderMaker` and `SphereMaker` because they had only one function being used. That common function became `ModelMaker::InitSimpleShape`, which takes the new enum `SimpleShapes`.

* `BuildingMaker` is not derived from `EntityMaker` anymore, as it shared very little with the rest of the makers.

* All makers now use the same `MouseMove` and `MouseRelease` from the `EntityMaker` base class. Removed `MouseDrag` and `MousePush` since they were not used.

* Snapping to grid has been centralized in the `ModelManipulator` and the hotkeys are all consistent now (issue #1583).

* PIMPLized

* Using `ign-math`

* Added `ModelMaker_TEST` and `LightMaker_TEST`.
update.title: Makers refactoring

content.raw: It passed
content.html: It passed

content.raw: One last jenkins [queued](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/436/) since all the last commits.
content.html: One last jenkins queued since all the last commits.

This pull request is mainly addressing issue #66, and also fixes issue #1583.

* Removed `MeshMaker` and `g_meshCreateAct` because they are not used and similar functionality has been moved to the Model Editor.

* Removed `BoxMaker`, `CylinderMaker` and `SphereMaker` because they had only one function being used. That common function became `ModelMaker::InitSimpleShape`, which takes the new enum `SimpleShapes`.

* `BuildingMaker` is not derived from `EntityMaker` anymore, as it shared very little with the rest of the makers.

* All makers now use the same `MouseMove` and `MouseRelease` from the `EntityMaker` base class. Removed `MouseDrag` and `MousePush` since they were not used.

* Snapping to grid has been centralized in the `ModelManipulator` and the hotkeys are all consistent now (issue #1583).

update.title: Makers refactoring

content.raw: I see, thanks for the explanation. I'll remove using here.
content.html: I see, thanks for the explanation. I'll remove using here.

content.raw:
I remember, clang had some warnings (fixed in 8579cd32e3ee) because [virtual void Base::Update()](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/2b9f6a3073f309d0242137ea7c17826f4e73a05f/gazebo/physics/Base.hh#Base.hh-173) had a different signature than [void Link::Update(const common::UpdateInfo &_info)](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/2b9f6a3073f309d0242137ea7c17826f4e73a05f/gazebo/physics/Link.hh#Link.hh-98). The `using Base::Update` allows `Link` to call either `Update` function, depending on the arguments.

So if they have the same signature, `using` shouldn't be needed.
content.html:
I remember, clang had some warnings (fixed in 8579cd32e3ee) because virtual void Base::Update() had a different signature than void Link::Update(const common::UpdateInfo &_info). The using Base::Update allows Link to call either Update function, depending on the arguments.

So if they have the same signature, using shouldn't be needed.

content.raw: The tests are still being run, but the build was successful with no new warnings. I can't remember why the `using` thing was needed in the past...
content.html: The tests are still being run, but the build was successful with no new warnings. I can't remember why the using thing was needed in the past...

content.raw: Interesting. The class and function looks like normal inheritance and overloading. It was my understanding that `using` was needed for function parameter disambiguation. Curious to see what the results are.
content.html: Interesting. The class and function looks like normal inheritance and overloading. It was my understanding that using was needed for function parameter disambiguation. Curious to see what the results are.

content.raw: Jenkins [running](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/438/) with branch `model_makers_no_using`
content.html: Jenkins running with branch model_makers_no_using

content.raw: Actually I just heard it might be an OSX thing. I'll remove them on another branch and start a homebrew jenkins to see whta happens.
content.html: Actually I just heard it might be an OSX thing. I'll remove them on another branch and start a homebrew jenkins to see whta happens.

content.raw: I just put them there without researching what it really does. I thought it would help the compiler know that a function from the base class will be used. I'll remove it.
content.html: I just put them there without researching what it really does. I thought it would help the compiler know that a function from the base class will be used. I'll remove it.

content.raw: There are multiple locations that have "using EntityMaker::". I can remove these, and the code still compiles. Are they needed?
content.html: There are multiple locations that have "using EntityMaker::". I can remove these, and the code still compiles. Are they needed?

content.raw: `std::to_string(i++);`
content.html: std::to_string(i++);

content.raw: See my previous comment about simplifying this chunk of code.
content.html: See my previous comment about simplifying this chunk of code.

This chunk of code can be simplified a bit:

int counter = 0;
std::string lightName;
do
{
  lightName = "user_" + dPtr->lightTypename + "_light_" + std::to_string(counter++);
} while (scene->GetLight(lightName));
dPtr->msg.set_name(lightname);

This is the one introduced in this pull request:

![makers2.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/601007612-makers2.png)

This pull request is mainly addressing issue #66, and also fixes issue #1583.

* Removed `MeshMaker` and `g_meshCreateAct` because they are not used and similar functionality has been moved to the Model Editor.

* Removed `BoxMaker`, `CylinderMaker` and `SphereMaker` because they had only one function being used. That common function became `ModelMaker::InitSimpleShape`, which takes the new enum `SimpleShapes`.

* `BuildingMaker` is not derived from `EntityMaker` anymore, as it shared very little with the rest of the makers.

* All makers now use the same `MouseMove` and `MouseRelease` from the `EntityMaker` base class. Removed `MouseDrag` and `MousePush` since they were not used.

* Snapping to grid has been centralized in the `ModelManipulator` and the hotkeys are all consistent now (issue #1583).

* PIMPLized

* Using `ign-math`

* Added `ModelMaker_TEST` and `LightMaker_TEST`.

[LightMaker](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/298/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_gui/LightMaker_cc.html) 100% function coverage, 54% branch coverage

content.html: Do you mean BoxMaker? I don't know why it's still there.

content.raw: By the way, do you know why there's coverage being generated for the deleted files? Is there some leftover of them which I forgot to cleanup or is this jenkins remembering the past?
content.html: By the way, do you know why there's coverage being generated for the deleted files? Is there some leftover of them which I forgot to cleanup or is this jenkins remembering the past?

content.raw:
Removed the unused function - I thought it would be useful and started making tests for it but it wasn't working well. At a second thought, I think making something from SDF might not be so useful, perhaps from a message is more useful at this point.

Added tests for the remaining functions. [New coverage queued](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/298/)
content.html:
Removed the unused function - I thought it would be useful and started making tests for it but it wasn't working well. At a second thought, I think making something from SDF might not be so useful, perhaps from a message is more useful at this point.

Added tests for the remaining functions. New coverage queued

content.raw: Regarding coverage, it looks like two of the uncovered functions (`InitFromModel`, `InitFromLight`) are used in `GLWidget::Paste`, but that isn't tested (at least in jenkins). `ModelMaker::InitFromSDFString` doesn't appear to be used anywhere.
content.html: Regarding coverage, it looks like two of the uncovered functions (InitFromModel, InitFromLight) are used in GLWidget::Paste, but that isn't tested (at least in jenkins). ModelMaker::InitFromSDFString doesn't appear to be used anywhere.

content.raw:
[coverage](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/): [ModelMaker: 82%](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/288/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_gui/ModelMaker_cc.html), [LightMaker: 91%](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/288/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_gui/LightMaker_cc.html). And interestingly, the deleted files appear in the report. Were they not properly removed?

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/): `ModelMaker_TEST.FromFile`  fails but I'm not sure why

[gpu looks ok](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/)
content.html:
coverage: ModelMaker: 82%, LightMaker: 91%. And interestingly, the deleted files appear in the report. Were they not properly removed?

homebrew: ModelMaker_TEST.FromFile fails but I'm not sure why

gpu looks ok

![makers.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3750000366-makers.png)

This is the one introduced in this pull request:

![makers2.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/601007612-makers2.png)

This pull request is mainly addressing issue #66, and also fixes issue #1583.

* Removed `MeshMaker` and `g_meshCreateAct` because they are not used and similar functionality has been moved to the Model Editor.

* Removed `BoxMaker`, `CylinderMaker` and `SphereMaker` because they had only one function being used. That common function became `ModelMaker::InitSimpleShape`, which takes the new enum `SimpleShapes`.

* `BuildingMaker` is not derived from `EntityMaker` anymore, as it shared very little with the rest of the makers.

* All makers now use the same `MouseMove` and `MouseRelease` from the `EntityMaker` base class. Removed `MouseDrag` and `MousePush` since they were not used.

* Snapping to grid has been centralized in the `ModelManipulator` and the hotkeys are all consistent now (issue #1583).

* PIMPLized makers

* Added `ModelMaker_TEST` and `LightMaker_TEST`.
update.title: Makers refactoring

* `BuildingMaker` is not derived from `EntityMaker` anymore, as it shared very little with the rest of the makers.
